title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 12 §§ 4-7.3 - Air supply for combustion
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 12 §§ 4-7.3 - Air supply for combustion

State Regulations

Sufficient fresh air shall be provided to the heat
generating apparatus to allow complete combustion of fuel at all firing rates. For gas- or oil-fired burners, the boiler room shall have at least one square
foot of opening for the entry of fresh air for every 2,000,000 Btu of fuel
burned per hour. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 12
§§
4-7.3

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
